text: It's the same game. They just called the series "Dragon Warrior" instead of "Dragon Quest" here in the US because they thought Americans would think Warrior sounded cooler.
author: phubans

text: Actually, it's because there was already a tabletop game bearing the name during the 80s. After TSR dissolved into Hasbro, Enix was able to use the Dragon Quest name internationally.

text: @Sephiko When I first went into a grotto I was like wait a second. What are my ears hearing? Thought about it and was like HOLY SHIT it's DQ IX! Some I don't think many other people notice is that DQ IX's primary dungeon music has a small portion of DQ IV's battle theme.

author: Emilio Joubert

text: @KingKrezKroQ Yep. Sugiyama is actually 79 years old now and he just composed for Dragon Quest IX. He's often referred to as the "Big Boss of game music" and inspired other VGM composer legends like Uematsu (Final Fantasy).

author: jesse ahmed

text:
I pretty much grew up with this series, especially the first four on the NES. I really think the DQs have some of the best video game music in general because it's almost constantly good. Sugiyama really is a master of his art, listen to the Dragon Quest Symphonic Suites. Anyways, I was really happy when I heard this song in Dragon Quest IX's grottos!

If you guys want, I could upload the Symphonic versions of the ones I've added to the list so far. I'd do that tomorrow.
author: SupraDarky
